understanding.p: A topic is a web page or a section in a print document. A topic must belong to a topic set and use the schema associated with the topic set. A topic appears under the topic set folder in an HTML document or as an entry in a print document's table of contents. It is not possible to present topics in a specific order within a topic set.

planning-question.planning-question-title: What do I need before adding a new topic?

planning-question-body.p: Before you add a topic, you must decide what schema to use.

li.p: You can use an existing schema and an existing topic set that uses the schema.
If your topic uses a new schema or a schema that does not have an associated topic set, you must first add a topic set.

doing.p: To add a new topic, create a file for your topic that includes the content that follows the schema you selected. To add the topic to a topic set, do one of the following:

li.p: Store your topic source file in a directory that is already included in the topic set configuration file. The build system automatically adds the topic to the document under the topic set folder..
Store your topic file in a new directory and add the directory path to the sources element of the topic set configuration. file.

doing.p: When you build your documents, if your topic appears in the document under the correct topic set and contains the correct content, you have successfully added a topic to the document.
